Josip šokiran: Migranti so mi vdrli v hišo in ukradli prihranke
»Znašel sem se iz oči v oči z moškim, ki je vdrl v hišo. Nakar se je iz drugih prostorov usulo še sedem moških in pobegnilo.«
04 Nov 2019, 11:45 by S. N.
JARUŠJE – »Prišel sem do vhodnih vrat hiše, poskusil sem jih odkleniti, pa sem videl, da so že odprta. Vstopil sem, zavohal sem cigaretni dim, nakar sem videl migranta in se prestrašil,« pripoveduje 61-letni Josip Ivanušević iz Jarušja pri Samoboru na Hrvaškem.Migranti iz BiH tavajo po krajih na meji s Hrvaško, večkrat pa potem skušajo vstopiti na Hrvaško, od tam pa v Slovenijo in zahodno Evropo. Včasih prehode iščejo sami, včasih imajo vodnike, med drugim tudi druge migrante. Med potjo spijo po gozdovih, včasih pa vdrejo tudi v kakšno hišo, ki jim nudi zatočišče pred mrazom.Josipa dva dni ni bilo doma, saj je odšel na zdravniški pregled v Bregano, kjer je prespal pri sestri. Ko se je po dveh dne vrnil domov, je v svoji hiši našel migranta. Ko je krenil proti njemu, se je iz drugih prostorov hiše usulo še sedem moških in pobegnilo iz hiše. Josip je odšel v zgornje nadstropje, kjer je bilo vse razmetano. Ukradli so mu oblačila in okoli 30.000 kun prihrankov. Josip je zato poklical sosede in policijo. Ta je hitro našla dva migranta, pri njiju tudi Josipova oblačila, denarja pa ne.

Joseph shocked: Migrants broke into my house and stole my savings
“I found myself face to face with a man who broke into a house. Afterwards, seven other men dared to escape and escape. "
04 Nov 2019, 11:45 by S. N.
JARUŠJE - “I came to the front door of the house, I tried to unlock them, but I saw that they were already open. I came in, I smelled cigarette smoke, and then I saw the migrant and I was scared, "says 61-year-old Josip Ivanušević from Jaruš near Samobor in Croatia. Migrants from BiH wander around places on the border with Croatia, and repeatedly try to enter Croatia from and to Slovenia and Western Europe. Sometimes they look for transitions on their own, sometimes they have guides, including other migrants. During the journey, they sleep in the woods, sometimes breaking into a house that offers them shelter from the cold. Joseph has not been home for two days since he went to a medical examination in Bregano, where he slept with his sister. When he returned home two days later, he found a migrant in his house. As he walked toward him, seven other men escaped from the other premises of the house and fled the house. Joseph went upstairs, where everything was tossed. He was robbed of clothes and about 30,000 kuna in savings. Joseph therefore called neighbors and police. She quickly found two migrants with Joseph's clothes on them but no money.
